bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake. Deposition of A. J. Smith..
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, WESTERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Moy Wah for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
A.J. Smith being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says:-

That he has been acquainted with Moy Wah, above named, at Portland, Oregon, for the last three or four years, and knows that has been engaged in business in said city; but that he is not so well or personally acquainted with said Moy Wah as with said Moy Chung.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 7th day of June, 1893
Notary Public in and for Pierce County, Residing at Tacoma, washington.
Let a writ of Habeas Corpus issue as prayed Returnable June 12th 1893
